intro: Ehrharta versicolor, commonly known as the variable grass or rainbow grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences that range from blue to purple and pink. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique floral display makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Ehrharta versicolor is also valued for its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
